instructions: # Character SheetInspired by Actoba's D&D 5E sheet and herrozerro's Savage Worlds sheet (with a special mention to Sam Marino for a spiffy json file).## ConfigurationIn the configuration section you can:* **UI Tweaks**  * Elect to show dice icons instead of drop down menus.      - This feature is only available for Attributes, Skills, and the Wild Die.      - It is not available in the Repeating Sections (though I hope to make it available in the future).      - The dice are color coded: d4=Red, d6 & d8=black, d10=blue, d12=green.      - The enhanced Trait Die Type Drop Down Menu uses the same field names as the regular drop downs, which introduces a risk for potential data loss. To minimize risk use only the standard textual drop down menu OR make periodic notations of all Trait ranks.        + **NOTE:** I've not experienced any problems (except with repeating sections, which is why this hasn't been implemented there yet. But, fair warning.  * Quest Font Type allows you to choose a handwriting font for the Quest Log section of the character sheet. To select a font, hover over the selection to the right of the Quest Font Type  * The Arcanum and Vehicle tabs can be hidden (they are shown by default)* **Game Setting Configuration**  * Additional Game Settings    - You can choose to add various fields to your character sheet to match your settings.  Settings supported so far include:      + All For One      + Deadlands      + Hellfrost      + Hellfrost: Land of Fire      + Interface Zero 2.0      + Lankhmar      + The Last Parsec      + Necessary Evil (and other Supers settings)      + Pirates of the Spanish Main      + Tour of Darkness (and other horrific settings)    - Additional settings and fields will be added as opportunity and demand allows. I hope to incorporate as many different Savage Worlds Settings as possible.    - There are three different Configuration "areas" to support different different game settings: Additional Derived Stats, Field Name Replacements, and Additional Setting Fields    - Additional Derived Stats      + Corruption      + Fame      + Firewall      + Glory      + Grit      + Neural Toughness      + Sanity      + Strain      + Street Cred    - Field Name Replacements      + Money        * Clams        * Credits        * Lankhmar currencies        * Livre        * Pieces of Eight      + Character Name        * Code Name      + Race        * Species      + Rank        * Threat Rating    - Additional Setting Fields      + Archetype      + Augments      + Engrams      + Fency Styles & Schools      + Homeworld      + Languages      + Max Load Modifier      + Motivation      + Occupation      + Permanent Injuries      + Ship Name      + TAP Readout      + Worst Nightmare* Backgrounds  - Choose a background image for your character sheet. Current available backgrounds include:    + Blank white sheet    + Cyberpunk    + Hellfrost-like    + Hellfrost: Land of Fire-like    + Last Parsec    + Noir    + Old Map    + Parchment    + Superhero    + Zombiepacalypse  - Additional backgrounds will be added as opportunity and demand allows.* Logos  - Choose a logo for your character sheet. Current available logos include:    + Savage Worlds Deluxe    + Savage Worlds Deluxe (Bloodied)    + All For One    + Deadlands    + Deadlands: Noir    + Deadlands: Hell on Earth    + Hellfrost    + Hellfrost: Land of Fire    + Interface Zero 2.0    + Lankhma    + The Last Parsec    + Necessary Evil    + Pirates of the Spanish Main  - Additional logos will be added as opportunity and demand allows.* Skills (Wild Card and Mook)  - All skills from the Savage Worlds Core Deluxe rules are included in the sheet, but are hidden by default. To manage them, click on the "+/- Core Skills" button on the Skills tab (right above Fighting) and place a check mark next to each skill you'd like to use.  - The sheet supports the optional Skill Specialization rule. To manage this, click on the "+/- Core Skills" button on the Skills tab (right above Fighting) and place a check mark next to "Use Skill Specialization"  - Fencing Styles and Schools are supported. click on the "+/- Core Skills" button on the Skills tab (right above Fighting) and place a check mark next to "Fencing Styles & Schools"* All Trait dice are limited to the standard d4-d12 dice. To accomodate certain Edges that allow one to have a trait die type that has a permanent modifier (ie Professional, Woodsman, etc.) use the modifier box to the right of each Trait die type.## Attributes & Skills* You can mouse over just about any field to get its attribute name.* All field titles follow Roll20's attribute syntax, ie. Agility would be displayed as "@{agility}" on mouse-over.## The Wild Die* The Wild Die is a configurable field to allow for Edges (such as Master) that may alter the Wild Die.## Rolls* You can mouse over any button to get its ability name.* Roll button titles DO NOT follow Roll20's ability syntax, using the selected token, ie. "%{selected|STR-check}", but will only show the attribute displayed like "@{AgilityRoll}".* The gm button uses the exact same formula for rolling as the regular button, but will whisper the roll to the GM.## Character Sheet* The Character Sheet view can be toggled between Wild Card and Mook using the button in the upper left-hand corner (default is Wild Card)* The Mook sheet is a stripped down version of the Wild Card sheet and does not roll a Wild Die for Trait Rolls.* The character sheet supports the DealInit API Script by providing a a field in the Configuration window where the various initiative altering edges can be represented.## Additional Notes* Most Repeating Sections have a "Hide Macro Formula" checkbox. Unchecking it will review a the formula to be used to create macros that simulate the roll buttons in repeating sections.* Apply Encumbrance Checkbox (in the skills sections) can be checked to automatically apply any Encumbrance Penalties to a particular skill roll. The standard skills already care for this automatically.* If there's something you want added, or you'd like to report a bug, please contact Finderski in the "Character Sheets" forum (putting Savage Worlds in the title will help me notice the post more readily, but isn't strictly necessary).## Special ThanksI'd like to thank the following for their help in the development of this sheet:* Shane Hensley (for giving permission to use all the Savage Worlds Settings Logos)---* Actoba* herrozerro* Brian (CSS wizard)I stole a lot of css/html from them* Everyone in the character sheet forum
